intro: Stillingia nervosa, commonly known as the Pacific mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive veining pattern. Stillingia nervosa is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky slopes.
